title: Please help Garen with aftershock
body:
You have the technology to change Mana flow band to Null orb on him, but you can't change Aftershock to Grasp of the Undying?
Even if there are cases where Aftershock can be used, Garen can't use it 99% of the time, so why allow him to pick a deliberate power deficit in terms of keystone masteries?

replies.body:
> there are cases where Aftershock can be used

tho

Yeah, I mean this is really the answer. We try to only swap runes as a very last resort - when a rune LITERALLY can't be used (e.g Magical Boots with Cass or Riverwalking on ARAM). 

We don't want to stifle player choice by swapping runes when they're just "bad" (emphasis on the quote unquote there) on a champion. Some really cool and surprising strategies have come from experimentation that goes against "accepted" strategies in specific cases (MF support off of the top of my head for example) and we would never wanna block that.

EDIT: I called this out in a comment down below but for Aftershock specifically we're going to be adding in the extra protection for champs that can't use it based on their kit. :)

Hum, in what case can Aftershock be used on Garen? He can't proc it **at all** by himself, and he can't proc it **at all** with Item Actives, since Actives are only soft CC.

So, as far as I can tell, Garen "LITERALLY can't use" Aftershock. Am I missing something? It sure looks like Magical Boots/Manaflow Band to me.

Penn commented below: 
> Pretty sure it procs on blastcone thing (cotc did). Its not a good reason to really take it, but its usable.

^ It does proc it.  

Like, it's possible we could say "this is way too niche a case" and add in the swapping protection for this one but for our first rule set around swapping we wanted to have a pretty hard line in the sand of "there is no way you could use it ever in any situation", with the examples again being Cass with Boots or ARAM with Riverwalking. 

I can bring this example up with the team to make a call on if "can be used with blast cone" is basically experientially equivalent to "can't be used" (because it's not possible to use it in the base kit or through the item system, etc.), but will re-iterate the reason it's not in there right now is that we wanted the rules around the protection swapping to be super clear.

EDIT: Okay, spoke with relevant folks & we're going to add the swapping protection for Aftershock in all modes. :) Thanks for bringing this up!

EDIT EDIT: Going to actually do this work for ANY champion who can't meet the requirement in this case, not just Garen. :D 

It's also possible that we further adjust these swaps in the future, wanna put that out there as well.

If it literally can't be used in ARAM (due to the lack of cones), would it make sense to disable aftershock for Garen (and the multitude of others without hard cc) in that mode?

(Playing devils advocate here; for the most part I tend to prefer letting people have enough rope to hang themselves so to speak, so don't even feel the existing disabled runes need to be.)

I think this is very fair and I also think there's a good case for added protection even on SR. 

Like, technically correct is not my favorite kind of correct - I would make the argument that 'usable on blast cone' is materially the same as 'not usable'.  I think at the very least we'll add the swapping protection for ARAM, if not SR.

That is an oversight on my team's (maps and modes!) part. Good note! We'll fix that for future releases :)

Have you thought about rather literally locking certain runes on certain champs/maps, so that the page would be rendered incomplete temporarily and would announce it?

In other words, player enters ARAM select with runepage with Riverwalking, it greys out and locks the rune making no rune be selected in the row and thus it will mark it red announcing that it must be changed like when you save and close incomplete runepage. This might be better for those who are not cautious about it as they know it happens and they have chance to choose replacement instead of it choosing something different hiddenly and possibly not something ideal.

So there are 3 basic issues with this approach (which we actually considered on the UI side earlier in the Runes process): 

1. We honestly can't tell what champion you're *actually* going to be in the game before you hit the loading screen - things like champion re-rolling in ARAM or swapping a champ with a teammate in draft mode throw this off (and would cause pages to toggle between bad/good or locked/unlock possibly multiple times in one champ select session)

2. We can't adequately warn you about any pages you make in advance (in the client or Inventory), which results in a weird disconnect between creating the exact same pages in champ select and the Inventory. 

3. We want to be really careful about marking pages invalid or causing players to miss any runes - it's painful to get an entire page swapped out right now (the current solution for a page with a single missing rune). We want to do as much "fix just this one rune" as we can, hence the swapping protection (and we hope to use preset pages to make individual rune swaps someday in the future to also help with this point).

Basically, it's a good proposal, but after weighing the pros and cons we decided to go with the 'swap protection' instead to solve these specific single rune cases.
